You are my wife. In consideration of the immense love and affection I have for you, I hereby declare that I and my family members have shared our family property in the village of Shivala as per the schedule below, and as per the income received from my share, the Gram Panchayat records show that the property is assessed as Assessment No. 341. From the date of registration in my name till today, I have given you the entire property including the R.C.C. Daba, which is a residential area of 350.38 sq. km., including all the rights I have in the property as per the schedule, and I have transferred all the rights I have in the property as per the schedule to you on this day and I have decided to keep this settlement property in my possession. From now on, I will pay all the taxes due on the property as per the schedule, and I will not have any power of sale or encroachment and I will not make any alienation. After me, you shall take possession of the Scheduled Property, pay taxes, enjoy it as you wish, and enjoy it with all the rights of donation, sale, and easement, and you, your son, and your grandson shall enjoy it in peace, freedom, and perpetuity for ever and ever. I hereby grant that whatever disputes may arise in connection with the property, whether caused by any impediments or by whomsoever, I or our local residents shall, at our own expense, remove such impediments and make this Settlement Property available to you or your local residents without interruption. I hereby declare to you, and assure you, that I have not transferred this property to any other person in any way, i.e., deeds, deeds agreements, mortgages, donations, guarantees, court seizures, any kind of shareholding liabilities, that it is my undisputed, unencumbered property in my absolute possession and that the survey number, dor. number, measurements, limits and boundaries are correct, that I have full rights in the said property, and that I have written this deed in your name.
This property is free from any allotments as per Andhra Government Act 9/77.
M. Notices have been filed for registration in the Gram Panchayat accounts.
Declaration:- I declare that the property transferred by this deed does not include any mango, sweet potato, betel nut or other trees or gardens, mines, mines, mines, ponds, etc. and I hereby certify that I will be liable for payment of any duty on such property as may have been previously found to have been concealed in this deed. -
-இ

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 385 of 2026, dated 30/Jan/2026, executed by Illa Subrahmanayam, in favour of his Wife, Illa Paarvathi, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 350.38 Sq. Yds, bearing house number 2-88, Assessment No. 341, comprised in survey number 90-3, situated in Sivala Village & Gram Panchayat, K. Gangavaram Mandal, within the District of Konaseema, registered at sub-registrar office Draksharama, is bounded as follows: North by: 60 Fts, Site of Marni Bapiraju, Site belongs to Donor South by: 59 Fts, Cement Road East by: 54 Fts, House of Chollangi Srinivasa Rao, Shed of Surampudi Ramana West by: 52 Fts, House of Dangeti Venkatarao

(A) As per Registered Documents: 1. The property in survey number 90-3, situated in Sivala, measuring about 350.38 Sq. Yds. was originally owned by Illa Subrahmanyam, who acquired the property through oral Partition from 1986.[Ref:Deed] 2. The aforementioned Illa Subrahmanyam, executed a Gift Settlement Deed on 30/Jan/2026, registered as document No. 385 of 2026, before the SRO Draksharama, in favour of his Wife, Illa Paarvathi, towards the property measuring 350.38 Sq. Yds., bearing house no. 2-88, Assessment No. 341, comprised in survey no. 90-3, Situated at Sivala Village. Note: It is found from the recitals of the deed that this is a conditional gift, wherein the donor, Illa Subrahmanyam, has reserved life interest over the property. Consequently, absolute ownership rights have not fully vested in the donee, Illa Paarvathi. Hence, it is advisable to include Illa Subrahmanyam along with Illa Paarvathi as co-applicants in the loan process. (B) Additional Documents Supporting the Title : The Property Demand Notice Vide No. 132, imprinted by the Sivala Panchayath Secretary, discloses that Illa Subrahmanyam, was demanded to clear the tax for the period Apr/2021 to Mar/2022, towards the property bearing House No. 2-88, and Assessment No. 341. Note: As per demand notice if the property tax due is not paid within 15 days from the date of the demand notice, the property will be confiscated. Hence, it is, advisable to verify that the tax is paid up-to-date towards the schedule property.

The property tax receipt attached discloses that Illa Subrahmanyam, is the taxpayer, hence, it is presumed that the mutation proceedings were not concluded in the name of the current owner Illa Paarvathi.

contentList: Document Name * Document Description * Document Date * Document Type

sections.content:
We have reviewed the documents provided to us as per the F.I. policy and have concluded that the Illa Paarvathi, possesses a clear, valid, and marketable title to the property measuring 350.38 Sq. Yds, bearing house number 2-88, Assessment No. 341, comprised in survey number 90-3, situated in Sivala Village & Gram Panchayat, K. Gangavaram Mandal, within the District of Konaseema, registered at sub-registrar office Draksharama.

Further, the current owner, Illa Paarvathi, is to be added as a party to the loan structure along with the applicant lla Subrahmanyam.
